thread.title: Huddersfield's Elias Kachunga being tracked by three Premier League clubs ahead of potential summer switch
thread.title_full: Huddersfield's Elias Kachunga being tracked by three Premier League clubs ahead of potential summer switch

author: Adrian Kajumba
title: Huddersfield's Elias Kachunga being tracked by three Premier League clubs ahead of potential summer switch
text:
Huddersfield's Elias Kachunga being tracked by three Premier League clubs ahead of potential summer switch The 24-year-old has netted 10 goals for the Terriers this season as they push for promotion Share Elias Kachunga has been a key player in Town's play-off push (Photo: Getty Images Europe) Share Get football updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Huddersfield's Elias Kachunga has fired himself onto the transfer shortlists of three Premier League clubs. 
Forward Kachunga is being tracked by Everton , Watford and Middlesbrough ahead of potential summer moves. 
The 24 year-old has been a revelation for promotion chasing Huddersfield and chipped in with 10 goals and three assists from a predominantly wide role, making him their top scorer this season. 
Kachunga joined fellow German David Wagner’s Huddersfield from Bundesliga outfit Ingolstadt in the summer on a season-long loan. Kachunga arrived with Wagner this summer (Photo: PA) 
The Terriers have an option to sign Kachunga permanently at the end of the season for £1.5m on a three-year deal. 
But he may now have a decision to make with interest from the top flight also mounting. poll loading Will Huddersfield gain promotion to the Premier League this season with David Wagner in charge? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
